title: Was McTominay unlucky to not get Spoty nomination?
description: Some in Scotland are unhappy after Scott McTominay missed out on shortlist for the 2025 BBC Sports Personality of the Year award.
fullText: A shortlist of six contenders has been announced for the 2025 BBC Sports Personality of the Year award, with some unhappy that Napoli midfielder Scott McTominay has not made the cut. The nominees are England footballers Hannah Hampton and Chloe Kelly, rugby union player Ellie Kildunne, darts player Luke Littler, golfer Rory McIlroy and Formula 1 driver Lando Norris.Voting will take place during the show on Thursday, 18 December with Gabby Logan, Alex Scott and Clare Balding hosting it live from MediaCityUK in Salford.

title: Weekly sports quiz: When did Salah last score for Liverpool?
description: How much attention have you paid to what's happened in the world of sport over the past seven days?
fullText:
So much has happened over the past seven days, including Arne Slot dropping Mohamed Salah from his Liverpool squad, Lando Norris winning the Formula 1 drivers' world championship title and Chelsea's unbeaten Women's Super League run coming to an end.

About 12% of quizzers got full marks in last week's edition. Will you make the grade this week?

After more quizzes? Go to our dedicated Football Quizzes and Sports Quizzes pages and

title: BBC Sports Personality of the Year 2025 contenders
description: A shortlist of six contenders has been announced for the 2025 BBC Sports Personality of the Year award. Footballers Hannah Hampton and Chloe Kelly, rugby union player Ellie Kildunne, darts player Luke Littler, golfer Rory McIlroy and Formula 1 driver Lando Norris are the nominees.
fullText:
A shortlist of six contenders has been announced for the BBC Sports Personality of the Year award for 2025.

Footballers Hannah Hampton and Chloe Kelly, rugby union player Ellie Kildunne, darts player Luke Littler, golfer Rory McIlroy and Formula 1 driver Lando Norris are the nominees.

title: Sports Personality of the Year shortlist announced
description: Find out who is on the shortlist for the 2025 BBC Sports Personality of the Year award.
fullText:
A shortlist of six contenders has been announced for the 2025 BBC Sports Personality of the Year award.

England footballers Hannah Hampton and Chloe Kelly, rugby union player Ellie Kildunne, darts player Luke Littler, golfer Rory McIlroy and Formula 1 driver Lando Norris are the nominees.

The programme - presented by Gabby Logan, Alex Scott and Clare Balding, and broadcast live from MediaCityUK in Salford - will celebrate 12 months of incredible sporting action.

Alex Kay-Jelski, director of BBC Sport, said: "This has been a breathtaking year for sport, driven by athletes whose performances belong in the history books.

"Each one has delivered moments of pure brilliance that have defined 2025.

"It's been incredible to watch, and I can't wait to honour their achievements, and to see who the nation chooses as the BBC Sports Personality of the Year 2025."

The public can vote online on the night for the main award, with full details announced during the show.

The Team of the Year award will also be decided by a public vote, with contenders to be announced on 15 December.

Other prizes awarded on the night include Young Sports Personality of the Year, Coach of the Year, Lifetime Achievement and the Helen Rollason Award.

The World Sport Star award, for which voting is open, will also be presented.

title: City name unchanged line-up for Real Madrid clash
description: Pep Guardiola has selected an unchanged side for the Champions League clash with Real Madrid at the Santiago Bernabeu. Club News City to wear EA SPORTS FC kit for Real Madrid clash The City boss goes ...
fullText:
Pep Guardiola has selected an unchanged side for the Champions League clash with Real Madrid at the Santiago Bernabeu.

The City boss goes with the same starting line-up that beat Sunderland 3-0 on Saturday in the Premier League.

GET YOUR TICKETS FOR CITY V BRENTFORD

Victory in game six of the league stage would see us move into the top-eight in the Champions League table as we aim to get one of the top spots to avoid the play-offs.

City travelled to Spain with a 21-man squad with Rodri, Mateo Kovacic and John Stones unavailable due to injury.

REAL MADRID XI: Courtois, Valverde (C), Asencio, Rudiger, Carreras, Tchouameni, Ceballos, Bellingham, Rodrygo, Gonzalo, Vinicius

Subs: Lunin, Fran Gonzalez, Endrick, Mbappe, Guler, Fran Garcia, Brahim, Cestero, Mastantuono, Martinez, Valdepenos

CITY XI: Donnarumma, Nunes, Dias, Gvardiol, O‚ÄôReilly, Nico, Bernardo (C), Foden, Cherki, Doku, Haaland

Subs: Trafford, Bettinelli, Reijnders, Ake, Marmoush, Ait-Nouri, Savinho, Khusanov, Bobb, Lewis

City are in the winning habit, with three victories on the bounce so Pep has stuck with a successful formula.

That should see Nico O‚ÄôReilly and Matheus Nunes as our full-backs either side of Ruben Dias and Josko Gvardiol.

Nico will playing in the holding midfield role with captain and Bernardo Silva and Phil Foden close by.

Erling Haaland will again lead the attack with Rayan Cherki and Jeremy Doku offering plenty of threat going forward for the Blues.

If this feels like a regular fixture, that‚Äôs because tonight‚Äôs clash will be the 15th time we‚Äôve met since the 2012/13 season, making it the most-played Champions League game during that time.

That probably reflects our positions as the most successful teams in Spain and England in recent years and even with the familiarity, it certainly hasn‚Äôt bred contempt, with the encounter as mouthwatering as ever.

This will be the fifth successive season that we visit the Santiago Bernabeu with two draws and two defeats in our last four trips and our last win there in February 2020 so a win is due.

City go into tonight‚Äôs match sitting 12th in the Champions League standings and a victory in the Spanish capital would move us into the top eight and therefore avoid the play-offs for the round of 16.

The new format means those games can present a real pot luck of an opponent; last season we had the tricky task of facing tonight‚Äôs opponents who are also the record winners of the trophy.

Ahead of tonight‚Äôs game, the table shows we would currently face either Italian champions Napoli or Azerbaijani side Qarabag, so it‚Äôs a game to be avoided if possible.

This will be the 15th time that Real Madrid and City have faced each other in the Champions League. Since their first meeting in the 2012/13 season, it is already the most-played fixture in the competition in this period (14 games).

City have lost our last two games against Real Madrid, suffering defeats home and away against them in last season‚Äôs play-off round. This is as many losses as we had experienced in our previous 11 games against the Spanish side combined.

Pep Guardiola has faced Real Madrid on 27 previous occasions, winning 48% of those matches and only lost one of his first nine away games. However, he is winless in the most recent four against the Spanish side and has never gone five in succession without beating them.

This will be the first managerial meeting between Xabi Alonso and Guardiola. Alonso made 79 appearances in his playing career under Guardiola, all for Bayern Munich between August 2014 and May 2016.

Since November 2024, City have lost six of our 12 games in the Champions League. Prior to this run of 12, their previous six defeats in the competition came over the course of 69 matches, between October 2018 and October 2024.

Real Madrid are currently on the third-longest streak of scoring in consecutive home games in European Cup/Champions League history (38 games), behind a 44-game run by Real Madrid themselves (September 2011-October 2018) and one of 45 games by Juventus (April 1973-September 2000). The last visiting side to keep a clean sheet away to Real Madrid in this competition was CSKA Moscow in December 2018 (0-0 draw).

Kylian Mbappe has scored nine goals in five games in the Champions League this season; the joint-most by a Real Madrid player in their first five appearances in a single edition, along with Cristiano Ronaldo in 2013-14 (9).

Erling Haaland has scored more goals in the Champions League than any other player since his debut campaign in 2019/20 (54). Indeed, two of the only three players who have netted 50+ goals in the competition in this period could both square off in this match, with Real Madrid‚Äôs Mbappe also netting 50 times since then (Robert Lewandowski being the other).

Mbappe has been directly involved in eight goals in seven games against City in the UEFA Champions League (seven goals, one assist); only Lionel Messi has had a hand in more against us in the competition - nine in eight appearances.

title: YouTube TV is planning to launch a cheaper 'skinny' sports bundle following its battle with Disney
description: YouTube TV will offer a cheaper sports-focused package in 2026, which it can offer after tough negotiations with Disney and other media companies.
fullText:
YouTube TV will unveil new prices soon. But this time, it will be good news for sports fans.

YouTube is launching a set of cheaper, slimmed-down versions of its popular live TV service in 2026, which it's calling "YouTube TV Plans," the video giant announced on Wednesday. One of the new plans will be a sports bundle that provides access to ESPN Unlimited, FS1, and NBC Sports Network.

While YouTube TV isn't yet revealing pricing for these 10 or so genre-specific packages, they'll cost less than the Google-owned service's typical rate, which is $83 a month.

"Our goal is to let you tailor your subscription with more options," said Christian Oestlien, YouTube's head of subscriptions, in a statement. "Whether you stick with our main YouTube TV plan with 100+ channels, focus on sports, combine sports and news, or select a plan centered on family or entertainment content, subscribers will be able to easily choose the plan that works best for them."

YouTube TV secured the rights to form these so-called "skinny bundles" after hard-fought negotiations with Disney, Comcast's NBC, and Fox. YouTube TV's battle with Disney was especially intense, as it left subscribers without ESPN and ABC for 15 days.

Justin Connolly, YouTube's global head of media and sports, said at a media event on Tuesday night that YouTube worked with its partners on "ingesting the entirety of the sports programming" in its service, so that YouTube TV can be a one-stop shop for sports fans. Besides aggregating live games, Connolly said YouTube is being fan-friendly by aiming to "meet the consumer where they are" on price.

YouTube TV's price has steadily increased since it launched in 2017 at $35, though it's also added more channels. Last December, YouTube TV's monthly price rose by $10.

Other TV providers have launched sports-focused skinny bundles, with some tradeoffs.

Fubo's $55.99 a month Sports + News bundle includes all of ESPN and Fox's channels, plus CBS and the NFL Network, but it doesn't have NBC or Warner Bros. Discovery's networks like TNT or TruTV. It also doesn't have the news networks CNN and MS Now (formerly MSNBC), though it has Fox News.

Sling TV's Orange & Blue bundle goes for $60.99 and has ESPN, Fox with cable sidekick FS1, WBD's channels like TNT and CNN, and the NFL Network. It also carries local channels like NBC and ABC in certain markets. But Sling doesn't have a deal with CBS, plus its main bundle doesn't include specialty sports networks like the SEC Network, the Big Ten Network, or NBA TV. Sling offers a Sports Extra add-on for $15 a month on its main plan, bringing the total to $76.

DirecTV's MySports package costs $69.99 but is more comprehensive, with the full suites of ESPN, Fox, and WBD, plus all four major local broadcast networks: ABC, CBS, NBC, and Fox (with possible exceptions in certain markets). It also carries the flagship networks for four major US sports: the NFL, NBA, MLB, and NHL.

Sports fans could complement those skinny bundles by buying a digital antenna or by using streaming services like Peacock or Paramount+ that give access to NBC and CBS, respectively.

ESPN also offers a subscription to its entire suite for $29.99 a month, or a bundle with competing streamer Fox One for $39.99 a month.

YouTube said its new sports plan will have ESPN's full suite of programming plus sports channels from Fox and NBC, with the option to add on NFL Sunday Ticket and RedZone for more money. Otherwise, it's unclear exactly which channels this bundle will have.

As YouTube TV's sports bundle enters the market, sports fans have more choices than ever. The challenge for them now is finding the right plan.

title: YouTube TV to roll out genre-based plans, deepens sports streaming bet
5 of Indy's top women sports execs open up: 'You have to be better'
description: This story is part of IndyStar's project "Only woman in the room:" How Indy became top city in nation for women sports execs
fullText:
This story is part of the IndyStar project "Only woman in the room:" How Indy became top city in nation for women sports execs

INDIANAPOLIS -- These five women have combined for more than 125 years of experience in sports careers and beyond. We asked them to give their best advice, lessons learned and how to navigate being a woman in the male-dominated sports industry.

Title: Chief operating officer of USA Track & Field since 2012

Notable career stop: Washington spent five years with the U.S. Department of Labor, starting as a staff attorney and ending her tenure as deputy associate general counsel.

Career highlight: Washington was a key figure as USA Track & Field was determining whether to move its national headquarters from Indianapolis. The organization announced last year it would remain in the city and move into IU Indy's new James T. Morris arena in the fall of 2026.

"Renee deserves a lot of credit for what they've been able to accomplish," said Julie Roe Lach, executive vice president of Pacers Sports & Entertainment, "including choosing to keep their headquarters in Indianapolis."

Advice for younger self: "I say it to young people all the time, the world is not over tomorrow. You think that you've got to decide what you're going to do now, and you don't. There is time. There's always a new chapter you can write."

Advice for women: "You can be competitive as women, but if you're going to do that, be competitive against the whole field, not just the women in the field. That is just so important."

Making a mark: "You have to understand the larger picture in almost anything that you do, which means that you have to ask questions and you have to be inquisitive. And that makes you do your job not just efficiently, you want to go beyond being efficient. It helps you know your organization, and it helps make you of more value than you might have ever thought."

Title: President of Andretti Global, chief operating officer of TWG Motorsports

Notable career stop: Gregory spent nearly 14 years with NASCAR as executive vice president and chief marketing and content officer.

For most of Gregory's career, she's been the only woman or one of few women in the room, and she's felt eyes looking at her, though she said she never had an overt incident where she felt unfairly treated because of her gender. Early on, she would sit off to the side of the room, instead of at the table, because she didn't have the experience or confidence to be there.

Advice for women: "There were times when you kind of look around and say, 'I can't pay attention to the fact that I'm the only woman in the room. I just need to do a good job and prove myself and deliver on my own merits and not get sidetracked and worried about the fact that you might be the only one.' You have to kind of just plow through that."

Still a way to go: "You see this explosion in women's sports, which is fantastic, and the fan consumption, and that's going to help. But when you get into some of the day in, day out, it's not quite as far along as you would think. It's going to catch up, but we still have some work to do. We used to say it doesn't have a finish line at NASCAR and that was on diversity in general. You have to be deliberate about it."

Bringing the A game: "As women in our various fields, you have to be prepared. You have to be better, in my opinion. And you've got to come with your A game all the time, and that does put a lot of pressure on you. But when you do that, you perform better, and then you gain more credibility, and then you have that reputation to build on, but you've got to invest the time in that up front."

Title: Senior vice president Penske Entertainment, leading marketing, branding, communications, content and broadcast across the IndyCar series and at Indianapolis Motor Speedway

Notable career stop: Melangton was the second woman in history to lead a Super Bowl as the CEO and president of the 2012 Indianapolis Super Bowl Host Committee. She once had a guy come up to her at a funeral and say, "Are you that lady running the Super Bowl? That's just crazy to me that they hired a woman."

"And I started laughing," Melangton said. "And instead of being offended, I said, 'Tell me why it's crazy.'"

Lesson learned: Early in her career, Melangton was working for Indiana Sports Corp. as director of events and was asked to help create the Big Ten women's basketball tournament. She went to work with the league negotiating, discussing, planning and, in 1995, it was set. The first tournament would be played at Hinkle Fieldhouse.

"It was so funny, I didn't know anything about basketball. And the first day, the athletes were throwing the balls out and they said, 'Did somebody break all these balls in?'" Melangton said. "I thought, 'What? I don't know anything about that.'" Melangton and her staff stayed up all night bouncing the basketballs on the court to get them broken in for the games the next day.

Advice for women: "Be the most confident person in the room, be better than everybody else, and it takes gender off the table."

In the eyes of her colleagues: "The authenticity that Allison brings to all of her relationships, whether she knows you for many, many years or is new, there's a confidence and a comfort level that she provides to other women, other female leaders that I think is just amazing," said Gregory. "It's something that motivates me. She leads by example."

Title: Executive vice president of Pacers Sports & Entertainment

Notable career stop: Lach spent more than a decade as commissioner of the Horizon League before being hired by the Pacers in October.

Her start in sports: "Basketball was always my love, from middle school. They say, 'When you find your passion, you lose yourself while you're doing it,' and I would just lose myself in the midst of the game because I just loved it." Lach was a basketball All-Star at Millikin University.

Some of Lach's favorite memories growing up happened on Sundays. The family would go to church, go home and watch WWF, then her dad would drop her off at the gym for pickup games. She'd wait on the sideline to get chosen on a team.

"I was always the only girl, but it didn't bother me because I could play, I could hang. You'd have to put up with some of the usual shenanigans, but I learned a lot," Lach said. "My dad's proudest moment and his hardest moment was when I got picked ahead of him. But that was always the joke. He'd say, 'I knew you'd finally made it when they were picking you because they wanted to win.'"

Lach was part of creating Indiana Sports Corp.'s 2050 vision, which included making Indy the women's sports capital of the world.

"No city has claimed it, because no city has done, I would argue, as much as we've already done," she said. "And it's not just sporting events, although that's important. It's women leading in sports."

Proudest accomplishment: "It's probably more behind the curtain. Those of us, especially in sports, get emails or calls or are approached by students or people that want to work in sports. I have coffee or Zooms or calls with people at least once or twice a week looking for some mentoring of how do you break in? it is definitely a pay it forward type deal, but it's the right thing to do. I think we all have a duty, and I think that's something that matters."

Title: Owner of Baughman Consulting, which specializes in sports management, bid concept and creation, hospitality and special events. She most recently was lead event director for WNBA All-Star 2025.

Notable career stop: Baughman spent nearly 22 years at Indiana Sports Corp., ending her tenure as senior vice president. Baughman has been a part of putting on Indy's biggest sporting events. Among them the Super Bowl in 2012, the NBA All-Star Game in 2024, the National College Football Playoff in 2022 and so many others.

When college football's biggest game was played in Indy, Baughman held the title of president of the 2022 College Football Playoff Host Committee. When she got the job, she had a sense of pride. She knew she had proven herself.

"It was more just like, 'You're really good at this. We trust you. We want you to do this.' Not, 'You're a woman and we should consider putting a woman in the position,'" she said. "Which to me is really important because I want to be the best person doing what I'm doing not the best woman doing something."

Ask questions: "There's so much to be learned from other people. And I feel like no one knows everything. And to be genuine in what you're knowledgeable about and what you think you have a fair opinion on. And when you're really seeking some guidance, that doesn't make you weak or less. It actually is really smart."

At the WNBA All-Star weekend this year, Baughman could be seen rolling carts, helping set up and tearing down, carrying boxes and inventorying T-shirts.

"Work your tail off. Do everything. Don't be like, 'Oh, I manage, I don't do those things.' Do whatever you need to do and help other people learn how to do it by doing it with them," Baughman said. "I don't really like layers and titles. You get a much better result if you can get people to do things collectively as a group, because it feels more like a shared outcome at the end of the day."

Sign of a good leader: "Let other people shine, and get out of the way sometimes."

In the eyes of her colleagues: "Susan is so creative. So many of the creative things you see in the city related to sports are all her," said Melangton. "She is deeply passionate and pours her entire self into whatever she's working on."

Follow IndyStar sports reporter Dana Benbow on X:¬†@DanaBenbow. Reach her via email:¬†dbenbow@indystar.com.

This article originally appeared on Indianapolis Star: Indy's top women sports leaders on mistakes made, advice

title: Skyrim Is Now On Yet Another Platform, But There's A Way To Upgrade For Free
description:
Yet another version of The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim is here, with developer Bethesda Game Studios mega-hit RPG now available for Nintendo Switch 2.
Skyrim continues to conquer every platform imaginable, and this time it's specifically 2021's Skyrim Anniversary Edition that's available on Nintendo's new console. This new version of the game does come with a few additional bells and whistles not found in the original Switch version, namely Joy-Con 2 mouse-control support. It also sports improved load times and performance in addition to features found in the original Switch version of Skyrim, like Legend of Zelda Amiibo support, Zelda-themed items, and motion controls.

title: Mathys Tel replaces Dominic Solanke in Tottenham Hotspur‚Äôs Champions League squad
description: Tottenham Hotspur have included Mathys Tel in their squad to face Slavia Prague today, according to RMC Sports journalist Fabrice Hawkins. Spurs host the Czech Republic club at the Tottenham Hotspur S...
fullText:
Tottenham Hotspur have included Mathys Tel in their squad to face Slavia Prague today, according to RMC Sports journalist Fabrice Hawkins. Spurs host the Czech Republic club at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium this evening in the Champions League, and the 20-year-old Frenchman has been selected despite not initially registering him for the league phase of the elite European competition. Tel replaces Dominic Solanke, who has yet to return from a long-term injury, in the squad.

üö®Exclusive French striker Mathys Tel is in Tottenham Hotspur's squad to face Slavia Prague this tuesday despite not being selected for the Champions League group stage. He replaces Dominic Solanke. pic.twitter.com/vaQOR7QTSg

‚Äî Fabrice Hawkins (@FabriceHawkins) December 9, 2025

Solanke joined Tottenham from Bournemouth in a ¬£65 million deal in the summer of 2024, and fitness issues have limited his impact so far. Spurs manager Thomas Frank dropped Tel for him in the Champions League squad at the start of the 2025-26 campaign but has been forced to change his mind. The French forward now has a chance to prove himself tonight as he is likely to be involved in action.

Tel has not been a regular in the Tottenham starting XI, with only four starts to his name in 13 appearances this term.

title: Voting open for World Sport Star of the Year - meet the contenders
description: Voting is open for the BBC Sports Personality's World Sport Star of the Year 2025 award.
fullText:
Six contenders have been shortlisted for the award, which will be presented during the live show on BBC One on Thursday, 18 December.

The 2024 World Sport Star award was won by Swedish pole vaulter Armand Duplantis.

Below you can vote for your favourite - and find out more about the contenders.

Spain midfielder Caldentey enjoyed a stellar first season in English football, with her performances instrumental in Arsenal's march to Champions League glory, beating her former club Barcelona in the final.

After scoring 19 goals in 41 appearances for the Gunners in her first season, Caldentey was named the Professional Footballers' Association women's player of the year and the Women's Super League player of the year.

Caldentey scored in the Women's Euro 2025 final, which Spain narrowly lost to England on penalties.

The 29-year-old was runner-up in the Ballon d'Or award, missing out to compatriot Aitana Bonmati, and was also included in Uefa's Champions League team of the year.

The making of Spain and Arsenal's humble magician

Arsenal's Caldentey wins WSL player of year award

Sport: Boxing Country: United States

Crawford cemented his status as one of the greatest boxers in history by becoming the first male fighter to be undisputed champion across three weight divisions in the four-belt era.

The 38-year-old had to go up two weight classes to face the great Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez at super-middleweight, but secured a unanimous decision in front of a fiercely pro-Mexican crowd in Las Vegas.

In claiming the WBA (Super), WBC, IBF, WBO and The Ring belts, the American extended his professional record to 42 straight victories - the past 20 of which have been world title fights.

However, Crawford was stripped of the WBC belt earlier in December, with president Mauricio Sulaiman claiming the American did not pay sanctioning fees.

'Crawford conquers Canelo to become the face of boxing'

History-maker Crawford stuns Canelo in Vegas

Sport: Athletics Country: Sweden

In 2025, Sweden's Duplantis once again soared above his rivals to capture a third pole vault World Championship gold.

In doing so, he set yet another world record of 6.30m - his fourth of this year alone - and the 14th of his remarkable career.

He also retained his indoor world title - meaning he has won eight successive golds in major global competitions - and won all 16 of his events to become the first male pole vaulter in modern history to go undefeated for two successive years.

In November, the 26-year-old was named men's world athlete of the year for a third time.

Duplantis gets 14th world record & third world title

The making of Mondo: How Duplantis is reaching new heights

Sport: Athletics Country: United States

McLaughlin-Levrone, the greatest female 400m hurdler of all time, made the switch to the 400m flat at the World Athletics Championships this year, but the result remained the same as she became the first athlete to claim career world titles in both disciplines.

Her time of 47.78 seconds was the second fastest in history and she came close to breaking a world record that has stood since 1985.

The 26-year-old is undefeated across both distances for two years.

She added another gold in the 4x400m relay in Tokyo and was named the women's world athlete of the year.

McLaughlin-Levrone wins 400m gold with second fastest time in history

Duplantis & McLaughlin-Levrone named world athletes of year

On the LA Dodgers' march towards retaining their World Series title, Japanese superstar Ohtani produced one of the greatest individual performances in Major League Baseball history.

The rare 'two-way' player, who operates as both a pitcher and a hitter, smashed three home runs and struck out 10 batters against the Milwaukee Brewers.

That made him the first pitcher since 1942 to hit three home runs in the same game.

The 31-year-old was named as one of baseball's Most Valuable Players for the third straight year, and the fourth time overall, moving him into second on the all-time list.

Ohtani wins fourth Major League MVP award

Ohtani rewrites history to send Dodgers to World Series

Salah, the 'Egyptian King', scored 29 Premier League goals and broke a host of records as he helped Liverpool to a record-equalling 20th top-flight title in the 2024-25 season.

He became the first player to win the Golden Boot, the Playmaker award for most assists and the Premier League player of the season award in the same campaign. He was also named as the PFA men's player of the year for a record third time and collected a third Football Writers' footballer of the year award.

The 33-year-old became the highest-scoring overseas player in Premier League history, overtaking Sergio Aguero's mark of 184.

Salah has scored five goals in 18 appearances for Liverpool so far this season, and on Saturday said he felt like he had been "thrown under the bus" by the club and that his relationship with head coach Arne Slot had broken down.

'The hunger makes me want more' - Salah wins third PFA award

title: Pokemon Thieves Make Off With $100,000 In Rare Cards
description: Pokemon cards are as hot as they've ever been, and unfortunately for a local card shop in California, it means their merchandise was the target of a recent heist. On December 2, thieves targeted LA Sports Cards in Burbank and made off with $100,000 or more in Pokemon cards and other collectibles. The trio of thieves were captured on camera in KTLA 5's video report below.

title: Voting open for World Sport Star of the Year - meet the contenders
description: Voting is open for the BBC Sports Personality's World Sport Star of the Year 2025 award.
fullText: Voting is open for the BBC Sports Personality World Sport Star of the Year 2025 award.Six contenders have been shortlisted for the award, which will be presented during the live show on BBC One on Thursday, 18 December.The 2024 World Sport Star award was won by Swedish pole vaulter Armand Duplantis.Below you can vote for your favourite - and find out more about the contenders.
